1.title: Smo Gets Sirius
1.plot: Smo meets with Sirius XM to get radio play on their country station. When they turn him down, he plans an epic drive-by concert to try to change their minds. At the same time, Ameria struggles to pass her driver's permit test, so Smo offers her an incredible incentive.

2.title: Big Smo and Rich
2.plot: Big Smo gets a chance to perform his new stage show for Nashville's elite promoters at country star John Rich's house. Matters at his own house are dire when Smo's daughter, Ansley, comes to visit and asks for help with a serious problem.

3.title: Lynyrd Skynyrd or Bust
3.plot: Smo gets the opportunity of a lifetime to open for Southern rock legends, Lynyrd Skynyrd. But when Mama's health takes a turn for the worst, Smo makes a tough decision that could jeopardize his career.

4.title: Big Smo 2.0
4.plot: Smo takes on a double tour schedule to win favor with his label Warner Nashville, but Alex drops a bomb before the band can hit the road. Back at the farm, Smo cooks up a plan to make his mom the next Rachael Ray.

5.title: Family Matters
5.plot: For the past year, Smo has been haunted by a bad performance at the biggest mud park in the south. Now, Smo returns to the mud bog with his family in tow in order to reclaim his victory.

6.title: Private Smo
6.plot: Smo surprises the troops at Fort Campbell with a free show plus a big charitable donation. Meanwhile, Whitney surprises the family with a rambunctious puppy that disrupts the peaceful farm.

7.title: A Rich Collaboration
7.plot: John Rich and Smo are together again -- this time to co-write a song that Smo believes is his best shot at convincing Warners to green-light a second album.

8.title: Big Smo's Kuntry Store
8.plot: Big Smo may have taken on too much when he begins construction on a country store to sell all of his merchandise. In the midst of the build, Lanica preps for her first middle school dance and Smo helps her dress the part.

1.title: Go Big or Go Home
1.plot: As Big Smo prepares for his first album release under Warner Nashville, he's trying his best to strike a balance between his music, his girlfriend and his family. While Smo rehearses for an important show in Cookeville, Tennessee, two of his band members are competing to be his opening act. At the performance, Smo gives his family, and the band, a huge surprise.

2.title: We're Gonna Need a Bigger Bus
2.plot: Big Smo and his band travel to gigs in a shuttle bus they've nicknamed the "Swag Wagon." Unfortunately their little bus dies, so Smo must find a replacement before they get back on the road. Also, Whitney knows she has Smo's heart... but his stomach is a different matter! Smo loves his mama's cooking above all others, but Whitney plans to change that (with Mama's help.)

3.title: Less Is SMO
3.plot: Big Smo will never be Little Smo, but his doctor tells him he needs to get more fit. Smo gets help from his bandmate "Coach" Alex, who creates a special workout called "Kuntry Crossfit". Meanwhile, Smo's daughters attempt to take care of a gift given to Smo from one of his fans -- a baby piglet!

4.title: Calling All Kinfoke
4.plot: It's game over if Big Smo can't deliver fans to the biggest show of his career. The gatekeepers of Nashville's music scene will be watching, and a large concert crowd will go a long way to endorse Smo's unique style of country. But bringing the farm folk to the city is no easy feat--especially during planting season--so Smo must rely on the "family" to get this job done.

5.title: Father Smos Best
5.plot: Smo gives the third degree to a boy who's trying to date his teenage daughter. Meanwhile, Smo and the band have completely outgrown his home studio, but Smo's worried they'll lose their music mojo if they rehearse anywhere else.

6.title: Smitney
6.plot: Who says a country boy can't have nice things? Well, Smo and Whitney's wedding planner might--unless the couple can find a way to cut down their massive list of kinfoke invitees. Meanwhile, Alex and Haden aren't distracting Smo from his wedding woes, they're adding to them, as they jockey for the prized spot as Smo's best man.

7.title: Workin'
7.plot: Big Smo lands a big budget to shoot his first official music video, but when his original idea is a bust, he takes to the streets to find real American workers that inspired the song. Smo's daughters want an xbox, so they sell homemade "Smo-cakes", and Smo shows them how to really hustle to get what they want.

8.title: The Grambler
8.plot: Big Smo is a big ol' mama's boy! With the band playing their first casino gig, Smo invites his mom along to see if he can inject his idea of fun into her mundane bingo routine. Playing a casino is uncharted territory for the band, and they find that acceptance from this new audience is a little less than they gambled for.

9.title: Big Smo and Darius Rucker
9.plot: Smo gets the biggest opportunity of his career--the chance to collaborate with multi-platinum, award-winning country music artist, Darius Rucker. But with only two days to create the perfect song, Smo has to cancel a romantic weekend with Whitney, and instead head into the Tennessee woods to write with his band. The resulting song with Darius could be Smo's biggest hit yet!

10.title: Boss of the Sauce
10.plot: Like many performers he admires, Smo wants to expand from music to multi-hyphenate mogul. And the next addition to his empire is going to be Meat Mud--a homemade sauce that he's been making for friends and family. With his music taking off, he now has the opportunity to get his sauce to a major distributor. So Smo gets his bandmates help with the cook, but going from making five jars to five hundred in a weekend looks like an impossible task.

11.title: Mr. & Mrs. Smith
11.plot: Big Smo and Whitney tie the knot in an unforgettable season finale. Smo's greatest hit yet brings Whitney to tears, and Alex and Haden have a surprise that literally sweeps the happy couple off their feet.

imdb.title: Big Smo
plot: Real life series following country rapper, _Big Smo_ (qv), as he takes his unique style of music to new heights with the support of lifelong friends, loyal fans, and his beloved family.::www.therealbigsmo.com
